message.content:
To determine how long it will take Tom to dry seven pairs of socks under the same weather conditions, we can use the information provided about the drying time for 10 pairs of socks.

Given that it took 10 hours to dry 10 pairs of socks, we can infer that the drying time is directly proportional to the number of pairs of socks. This means if we double the number of pairs of socks, the drying time will also double. Similarly, if we halve the number of pairs of socks, the drying time will be halved.

Now, Tom wants to know how long it will take to dry seven pairs of socks. Since 10 pairs took 10 hours, one pair would take 1 hour (10 hours / 10 pairs = 1 hour per pair). Therefore, seven pairs would take:

7 pairs * 1 hour/pair = 7 hours

So, under the same weather conditions, it will take Tom approximately 7 hours to dry seven pairs of socks.
